result.execSummary:
Troyce Broadway was extradited to another county, state or jurisdiction. Extradition means Troyce Broadway was accused or convicted of an offense in another county, state or jurisdiction and was taken there to face their charge(s) or conviction.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Troyce Broadway

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Letter to Gov. Walker w/certified copy of Waiver of Extradition. mailed 01-13-16
signed by Troyce Broadway, Defendant and the Court /s/RJS 01-12-15.

1:51 pm. Court calls case.
Atty Constable indicates that the defendant wishes to waive his extradition hearing which is presented to the defendant.
Court questions the defendant.
Atty Constable makes additional statements.
Court questions defendant if he understands that he is waiving the right to an extradition hearing.
Defendant indicates that he understands that he is waiving his right to the extradition hearing.
Defendant signs the waiver.
Court has signed the waiver as well.
